body:
What PHP and MySQL versions is that on?

Edit: Also, what are the field types?

Hello,

The first system is with PHP Version 5.5.9-1ubuntu4.22 and MySQL server versie | 5.5.57-0ubuntu0.14.04.1

The second system is a Centos system with PHP 5.6.31 and MySQL mysqlnd 5.0.11-dev.

The fields you saw were varchar fields.

Greetings,
Ubel Jan van Wijhe
Thanks. Though ... that turned out to be irrelevant; I found the issue already.
Was caused by the patch for #5260. See referenced commit for the fix.

issue.title: Kindly replace array values with type numbers

repository.name: CodeIgniter
repository.description: Open Source PHP Framework (originally from EllisLab)

issue.body:
https://github.com/bcit-ci/CodeIgniter/blob/6607ca29fcf3da49ed562aefe4e3f8ceb91c32f1/system/database/drivers/mysqli/mysqli_utility.php#L159

http://php.net/manual/en/mysqli-result.fetch-field.php

`fetch_field()` returns type numbers so, kindly replace it with type number instead of name.

`array( 1, 2, 9, 3, 8 )`

`$is_int[$i] = in_array($field->type,
                            array( 1, 2, 9, 3, 8),
                            TRUE);`

numerics
-------------
BIT: 16
TINYINT: 1
BOOL: 1
SMALLINT: 2
MEDIUMINT: 9
INTEGER: 3
BIGINT: 8
SERIAL: 8
FLOAT: 4
DOUBLE: 5
DECIMAL: 246
NUMERIC: 246
FIXED: 246

Fixed here : 

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46178066/codigniter-backup-library-creating-wrong-insert-query/46182021#46182021

body:
I have the same problem on 3.1.6, it's not clear will it be fixed?
All the best

Hello,
I have create a database backup using codeigniter $this->load->dbutil(); This Work fine and I can download my database backup. But I try to restore this backup and I got below error..

SQL query:

INSERT INTO app_user (id, user_name, email, password, role, status) VALUES (10, Admin.sgh, admin@supreme.lk, 202cb962ac59075b964b07152d234b70, 0, 0)
MySQL said: Documentation

#1064 - You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near '@supreme.lk, 202cb962ac59075b964b07152d234b70, 0, 0)' at line 1

Can you help me to resolve this error. I am using codeigniter 3.1.6 Version..

issue.title: Codeigniter Backup Restore Error

repository.name: CodeIgniter
repository.description: Open Source PHP Framework (originally from EllisLab)

issue.body:
Hello,
I have create a database backup using codeigniter $this->load->dbutil(); This Work fine and I can download my database backup. But I try to restore this backup and I got below error..

SQL query:


INSERT INTO `app_user` (`id`, `user_name`, `email`, `password`, `role`, `status`) VALUES (10, Admin.sgh, admin@supreme.lk, 202cb962ac59075b964b07152d234b70, 0, 0)
MySQL said: Documentation

#1064 - You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near '@supreme.lk, 202cb962ac59075b964b07152d234b70, 0, 0)' at line 1

**Can you help me to resolve this error. I am using codeigniter  3.1.6 Version..**

body: Any one know how to resolve this error?
Any one know how to resolve this error?

issue.title: Database Restore Issue

repository.name: CodeIgniter
repository.description: Open Source PHP Framework (originally from EllisLab)

issue.body:
Hello,
I have create a database backup using codeigniter $this->load->dbutil(); This Work fine and I can download my database backup. But I try to restore this backup and I got below error..

SQL query:

INSERT INTO app_user (id, user_name, email, password, role, status) VALUES (10, Admin.sgh, admin@supreme.lk, 202cb962ac59075b964b07152d234b70, 0, 0)
MySQL said: Documentation

#1064 - You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near '@supreme.lk, 202cb962ac59075b964b07152d234b70, 0, 0)' at line 1

body: @sanjayacloud you can upgrade your CI to the last stable version from this github, then database backup works properly.
